local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show categories field in the event/meeting editor

local_schema.short_desc: Show timezone field in the event/meeting editor
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show timezone field in the event/meeting editor

local_schema.short_desc: Show RSVP field in the event/task/meeting editor
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show RSVP field in the event/task/meeting editor

local_schema.short_desc: Show type field in the event/task/meeting editor
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show type field in the event/task/meeting editor

local_schema.short_desc: Show status field in the event/task/meeting editor
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show status field in the event/task/meeting editor

local_schema.short_desc: Show Role field in the event/task/meeting editor
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show role field in the event/task/meeting editor
Whether to show times in twenty four hour format instead of using am/pm.

local_schema.short_desc: Maximum number of recently used timezones to remember.
local_schema.longdesc: Maximum number of recently used timezones to remember in a 'day_second_zones' list.

local_schema.short_desc: Recently used second time zones in a Day View
local_schema.longdesc: List of recently used second time zones in a Day View.

local_schema.short_desc: The second timezone for a Day View
local_schema.longdesc: Shows the second time zone in a Day View, if set. Value is similar to one used in a 'timezone' key.
Use the system timezone instead of the timezone selected in Evolution.
The default timezone to use for dates and times in the calendar, as an untranslated Olsen timezone database location like "America/New York".
URI of the highlighted ("primary") calendar
Controls how frequently local changes are synchronized with the remote mail server. The interval must be at least 30 seconds.
Initial width of the "Search Folder Editor" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window horizontally.

Initial maximize state of the "Search Folder Editor" window. The value updates when the user maximizes or unmaximizes the window. Note, this particular value is not used by Evolution since the "Search Folder Editor" window cannot be maximized. This key exists only as an implementation detail.
Initial height of the "Search Folder Editor" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window vertically.
Initial width of the "Send and Receive Mail" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window horizontally.

local_schema.short_desc: "Send and Receive Mail" window maximize state
local_schema.longdesc: Initial maximize state of the "Send and Receive Mail" window. The value updates when the user maximizes or unmaximizes the window. Note, this particular value is not used by Evolution since the "Send and Receive Mail" window cannot be maximized. This key exists only as an implementation detail.
Initial height of the "Send and Receive Mail" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window vertically.
Initial width of the "Filter Editor" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window horizontally.

Initial maximize state of the "Filter Editor" window. The value updates when the user maximizes or unmaximizes the window. Note, this particular value is not used by Evolution since the "Filter Editor" window cannot be maximized. This key exists only as an implementation detail.
Initial height of the "Filter Editor" window. The value updates as the user resizes the window vertically.
Directory for saving mail component files.
List of protocol names whose license has been accepted.
List of accounts known to the mail component of Evolution. The list contains strings naming subdirectories relative to /apps/evolution/mail/accounts.

local_schema.short_desc: UID string of the default account.
local_schema.longdesc: UID string of the default account.

local_schema.short_desc: List of Labels and their associated colors
local_schema.longdesc: List of labels known to the mail component of Evolution. The list contains strings containing name:color where color uses the HTML hex encoding.
Default maximized state of the mail browser window.
Default height of the mail browser window.
Default width of the mail browser window.

local_schema.short_desc: List of keyword/value pairs for the Templates plugin to substitute in a message body.
local_schema.longdesc: List of keyword/value pairs for the Templates plugin to substitute in a message body.

local_schema.short_desc: List of clues for the attachment reminder plugin to look for in a message body
local_schema.longdesc: List of clues for the attachment reminder plugin to look for in a message body.

local_schema.short_desc: Last time empty trash was run
local_schema.longdesc: The last time empty trash was run, in days since the epoch.

local_schema.short_desc: Minimum days between emptying the trash on exit
local_schema.longdesc: Minimum time between emptying the trash on exit, in days.
Empty all Trash folders when exiting Evolution.

local_schema.short_desc: Check whether Evolution is the default mailer
local_schema.longdesc: Every time Evolution starts, check whether or not it is the default mailer.

local_schema.short_desc: Prompt when deleting messages in search folder
local_schema.longdesc: It disables/enables the repeated prompts to warn that deleting messages from a search folder permanently deletes the message, not simply removing it from the search results.
Enable or disable the prompt whilst marking multiple messages.

local_schema.short_desc: Prompt when user tries to open 10 or more messages at once
local_schema.longdesc: If a user tries to open 10 or more messages at one time, ask the user if they really want to do it.

local_schema.short_desc: Prompt when user tries to send unwanted HTML
local_schema.longdesc: Prompt when user tries to send HTML mail to recipients that may not want to receive HTML mail.

local_schema.short_desc: Prompt when user only fills Bcc
local_schema.longdesc: Prompt when user tries to send a message with no To or Cc recipients.
Prompt the user when he or she tries to expunge a folder.
Prompt the user when he or she tries to send a message without a Subject.
Logfile to log filter actions.
Log filter actions to the specified log file.
Default height of the subscribe dialog.
Default width of the subscribe dialog.
Show the original "Date" header (with a local time only if the time zone differs). Otherwise always show "Date" header value in a user preferred format and local time zone.

local_schema.short_desc: Level beyond which the message should be logged.
local_schema.longdesc: This can have three possible values. "0" for errors. "1" for warnings. "2" for debug messages.

local_schema.short_desc: Amount of time in seconds the error should be shown on the status bar.
local_schema.longdesc: Amount of time in seconds the error should be shown on the status bar.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether sort threads based on latest message in that thread
local_schema.longdesc: This setting specifies whether the threads should be sorted based on latest message in each thread, rather than by message's date. Evolution requires a restart.

local_schema.short_desc: Default value for thread expand state
local_schema.longdesc: This setting specifies whether the threads should be in expanded or collapsed state by default. Evolution requires a restart.

local_schema.short_desc: Thread the message-list based on Subject
local_schema.longdesc: Whether or not to fall back on threading by subjects when the messages do not contain In-Reply-To or References headers.

local_schema.short_desc: Number of addresses to display in TO/CC/BCC
local_schema.longdesc: This sets the number of addresses to show in default message list view, beyond which a '...' is shown.
This decides the max size of the text part that can be formatted under Evolution. The default is 4MB / 4096 KB and is specified in terms of KB.

local_schema.short_desc: Allows Evolution to display text part of limited size
local_schema.longdesc: Enable to render message text part of limited size.

local_schema.short_desc: Compress display of addresses in TO/CC/BCC
local_schema.longdesc: Compress display of addresses in TO/CC/BCC to the number specified in address_count.

The layout style determines where to place the preview pane in relation to the message list. "0" (Classic View) places the preview pane below the message list. "1" (Vertical View) places the preview pane next to the message list.
Width of the message-list pane.
Height of the message-list pane.

local_schema.short_desc: Hides the per-folder preview and removes the selection
local_schema.longdesc: This key is read only once and reset to "false" after read. This unselects the mail in the list and removes the preview for that folder.
Enable search folders on startup.

local_schema.short_desc: Show deleted messages in the message-list
local_schema.longdesc: Show deleted messages (with a strike-through) in the message-list.

local_schema.short_desc: Timeout for marking message as seen
local_schema.longdesc: Timeout for marking message as seen.

local_schema.short_desc: Determines whether to use the same fonts for both "From" and "Subject" lines in the "Messages" column in vertical view.
local_schema.longdesc: Determines whether to use the same fonts for both "From" and "Subject" lines in the "Messages" column in vertical view.

local_schema.short_desc: Sender email-address column in the message list
local_schema.longdesc: Show the email-address of the sender in a separate column in the message list.

local_schema.short_desc: Mark as Seen after specified timeout
local_schema.longdesc: Mark as Seen after specified timeout.

local_schema.short_desc: List of MIME types to check for Bonobo component viewers
local_schema.longdesc: If there isn't a builtin viewer for a particular MIME type inside Evolution, any MIME types appearing in this list which map to a Bonobo component viewer in GNOME's MIME type database may be used for displaying content.

local_schema.short_desc: Search for the sender photo in local address books
local_schema.longdesc: This option would help in improving the speed of fetching.
Show the photo of the sender in the message reading pane.

local_schema.short_desc: List of custom headers and whether they are enabled.
local_schema.longdesc: This key should contain a list of XML structures specifying custom headers, and whether they are to be displayed. The format of the XML structure is <header enabled> - set enabled if the header is to be displayed in the mail view.
Show all the headers when viewing a messages.
Show animated images as animations.

local_schema.short_desc: Load images for HTML messages over HTTP
local_schema.longdesc: Load images for HTML messages over HTTP(S). Possible values are: "0" - Never load images off the net. "1" - Load images in messages from contacts. "2" - Always load images off the net.

local_schema.short_desc: Default charset in which to display messages
local_schema.longdesc: Default charset in which to display messages.
Enable caret mode, so that you can see a cursor when reading mail.
Citation highlight color.
Mark citations in the message "Preview".

local_schema.short_desc: Enable or disable magic space bar
local_schema.longdesc: Enable this to use Space bar key to scroll in message preview, message list and folders.

local_schema.short_desc: Disable or enable ellipsizing of folder names in side bar
local_schema.longdesc: Whether disable ellipsizing feature of folder names in side bar.

local_schema.short_desc: Enable or disable type ahead search feature
local_schema.longdesc: Enable the side bar search feature to allow interactive searching of folder names.
Enable animated images in HTML mail. Many users find animated images annoying and prefer to see a static image instead.
Use custom fonts for displaying mail.
The terminal font for mail display.
The variable width font for mail display.
Directory for loading/attaching files to composer.
Default height of the Composer Window.
Default width of the Composer Window.
Set to TRUE in case you do not want to add signature delimiter before your signature when composing a mail.

local_schema.short_desc: Put personalized signatures at the top of replies
local_schema.longdesc: Users get all up in arms over where their signature should go when replying to a message. This determines whether the signature is placed at the top of the message or the bottom.

local_schema.short_desc: Encode file names in an Outlook/GMail way
local_schema.longdesc: Encode file names in the mail headers same as Outlook or GMail do, to let them display correctly file names with UTF-8 letters sent by Evolution, because they do not follow the RFC 2231, but use the incorrect RFC 2047 standard.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "Reply To" field when posting to a newsgroup
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "Reply To" field when posting to a newsgroup. This is controlled from the View menu when a news account is chosen.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "From" field when posting to a newsgroup
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "From" field when posting to a newsgroup. This is controlled from the View menu when a news account is chosen.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "Reply To" field when sending a mail message
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "Reply To" field when sending a mail message. This is controlled from the View menu when a mail account is chosen.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "From" field when sending a mail message
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "From" field when sending a mail message. This is controlled from the View menu when a mail account is chosen.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "Cc" field when sending a mail message
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "Cc" field when sending a mail message. This is controlled from the View menu when a mail account is chosen.

local_schema.short_desc: Show "Bcc" field when sending a mail message
local_schema.longdesc: Show the "Bcc" field when sending a mail message. This is controlled from the View menu when a mail account is chosen.
List of dictionary language codes used for spell checking.
Underline color for misspelled words when using inline spelling.
Send HTML mail by default.
Whether a read receipt request gets added to every message by default.

local_schema.short_desc: Put the cursor at the bottom of replies
local_schema.longdesc: Users get all up in arms over where the cursor should go when replying to a message. This determines whether the cursor is placed at the top of the message or the bottom.
Recognize emoticons in text and replace them with images.
Recognize links in text and replace them.
Draw spelling error indicators on words as you type.

local_schema.short_desc: Default charset in which to compose messages
local_schema.longdesc: Default charset in which to compose messages.

local_schema.short_desc: Custom headers to use while checking for junk.
local_schema.longdesc: Custom headers to use while checking for junk. The list elements are string in the format "headername=value".

local_schema.short_desc: Determines whether to use custom headers to check for junk
local_schema.longdesc: Determines whether to use custom headers to check for junk. If this option is enabled and the headers are mentioned, it will be improve the junk checking speed.

local_schema.short_desc: Determines whether to look up addresses for junk filtering in local address book only
local_schema.longdesc: This option is related to the key lookup_addressbook and is used to determine whether to look up addresses in local address book only to exclude mail sent by known contacts from junk filtering.

local_schema.short_desc: Determines whether to lookup in address book for sender email
local_schema.longdesc: Determines whether to lookup the sender email in address book. If found, it shouldn't be a spam. It looks up in the books marked for autocompletion. It can be slow, if remote address books (like LDAP) are marked for autocompletion.

local_schema.short_desc: The default plugin for Junk hook
local_schema.longdesc: This is the default junk plugin, even though there are multiple plugins enabled. If the default listed plugin is disabled, then it won't fall back to the other available plugins.

local_schema.short_desc: Last time empty junk was run
local_schema.longdesc: The last time empty junk was run, in days since the epoch.

local_schema.short_desc: Minimum days between emptying the junk on exit
local_schema.longdesc: Minimum time between emptying the junk on exit, in days.
Empty all Junk folders when exiting Evolution.
Run junk test on incoming mail.
Use SpamAssassin daemon and client (spamc/spamd).
Use only the local spam tests (no DNS).
Convert message text to Unicode UTF-8 to unify spam/ham tokens coming from different character sets.
